programs.title: Google keynote
programs.description: Tune in to find out how we're furthering our mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful.
programs.short_description: Tune in to find out how we're furthering our mission to organize the world's information and make it universally acce...

programs.title: Developer keynote
programs.description: Learn about Google's developer products, solutions, and technology and see what we're doing to help you build smarter and ship faster.
programs.short_description: Learn about Google's developer products, solutions, and technologies and see what we're doing to help you build smart...

programs.title: What's new in Android Accessibility
programs.description:
Providing accessible apps ensures equal access to roughly one billion people in the world with disabilities. It also benefits people without disabilities by allowing them to customize their experiences.

In this session, learn about the new accessibility features and settings coming to Android, along with updates in the developer space to help you build apps for everyone.
programs.short_description: Learn about new Android accessibility features and developer updates to help you build apps for everyone.

programs.title: What's new in Android
programs.description: Get the latest news on everything happening in the world of Android development: Android 14, form factors, Jetpack, Compose, tooling, performance and more.
programs.short_description: Get the latest news in Android development: Android 14, form factors, Jetpack, Compose, tooling and performance.

programs.title: What's new in Google Pay and Google Wallet
programs.description: Discover the latest updates to Google Pay and Wallet. Learn about partnerships within the Google ecosystem that minimize fraud and bring more verified payment methods to more markets. Dive into new API features that allow developers to optimize checkout conversions and testing. Explore the expanded support for Google Wallet across Android and Wearables, verticals, and experiences.
programs.short_description: Discover new product features and APIs for Google Pay and Wallet.

speakers.name: Edson Yanaga
speakers.role: Staff Developer Relations Engineer, Wallet Lead

programs.title: What’s new in ChromeOS
programs.description: Whether you're building for consumers, enterprise, or education, learn about the latest innovations in ChromeOS. Get a roundup of tools, features, and guidance to create world-class apps and games. Discover how developers are building cross-platform experiences that are powered by Android or web to reach users and grow their businesses on Chromebooks.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest innovations, tools, and developer guidance to create world-class app experiences for ChromeOS.

programs.title: What’s new in Material Design
programs.description: Join Material for an overview of the latest evolution to our design language, Material You, and a look at our vision of the future of design systems. We’ll showcase new components and features that enable designers and developers to create beautiful, usable experiences. This session will also dive into motion capabilities, new color customization features, Android and Flutter library updates, and design tooling that helps integrate Material Design into your workflow.
programs.short_description: Learn what’s new in Material Design, including new components and motion and color capabilities.

programs.title: What's new in AR
programs.description: Get the latest on Google AR, including updates to ARCore, Google's augmented reality platform for developers. Learn how it's easier than ever to build world-anchored, immersive experiences.
programs.short_description: Get the latest on Google AR, including updates to ARCore, Google's augmented reality platform for developers.

programs.title: What's new in Firebase
programs.description: Firebase is the thread that simplifies the communication between all parts of your stack. Discover the newest features like running server code, quickly finding and fixing crashes, and strengthening app security.
programs.short_description: Learn all about the new features and announcements around building full stack apps in Firebase.

programs.title: What's new in Dart and Flutter
programs.description: Learn the latest from Dart and Flutter, including how they enable you to  build beautiful native apps for any platform. This session covers breakthrough graphics performance, seamless integration, emerging architectures and platforms, and developer experience.
programs.short_description: Learn the latest from Dart and Flutter, including how to build beautiful native apps for any platform.

programs.title: What's new in Google Play
programs.description: Learn about the latest tools and updates designed to help you grow your business on Google Play.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest tools and updates designed to help you grow your business on Google Play.

speakers.name: Deepthi Menon
speakers.role: Director of Product for Google Play

programs.title: What's new in Google Home
programs.description: Discover how your connected devices can do more with Google Home using Matter and Automations.
programs.short_description: Discover how your connected devices can do more with Google Home using Matter and Automations.

programs.title: What's new in web
programs.description:
What kinds of new API launched on the web this year? Is that experimental CSS ready to use in production?  How about the new JavaScript standard? 
This session will go over new features that became stable on the Web Platform this year, and demonstrate new standard ways to author web applications without cumbersome hacks or extra libraries and polyfills.
programs.short_description: Showcase of new features and APIs that became stable across browsers on the Web Platform this year.

programs.title: What's new in Generative AI
programs.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are capturing the imaginations of people around the world. At Google I/O, we're excited to share a new suite of tools that make it easy for developers to build on top of our best models. In this keynote, we'll introduce tools and APIs you can use that equip computers with the ability to comprehend and generate natural language with a kind of nuance and fluidity that was never possible before.
programs.short_description: Discover a new suite of tools that make it easy for developers to build on top of Google's best Large Language Models.

programs.title: What's new in Google Cloud
programs.description: AI has become front and center when it comes to driving developer velocity. The cloud keynote will showcase all of the innovations across generative AI and other areas that help you develop faster and more efficiently.
programs.short_description: Learn how Google Cloud and generative AI will help you develop faster and more efficiently.

speakers.name: Richard Seroter
speakers.role: Director of Developer Relations and Outbound Product Management

speakers.name: Yulie Kwon Kim
speakers.role: Vice President of Product Management, Google Workspace

programs.title: What's new in machine learning
programs.description: Machine learning continues to grow and thrive, and new innovations for developers emerge on an almost daily basis. In this keynote you'll discover the latest innovations within Google's machine learning ecosystem to help you navigate technology to bring ML to any device, website, or app.
programs.short_description: Get a tour Google's machine learning ecosystem for developers.

speakers.name: Chuo-Ling Chang
speakers.role: Tech Lead Manager, MediaPipe, Core ML

programs.title: Embrace accessibility for more beautiful products with Material Design
programs.description: Learn how accessible design allows us to be more expressive and more opinionated as product designers. Discover how Material Design conducts research to create accessible and beautiful experiences. Get tips on how to design with accessibility in mind when building your own products.
programs.short_description: Learn how Material Design uses experimentation and exploration to create more expressive and accessible products.

programs.title: A developer's guide to BigQuery export for Google Analytics 4
programs.description:
With Google Analytics 4 (GA4), anyone can set up export of granular measurement data to BigQuery.

In this session, you will learn how to use the BigQuery export for solving business problems, doing complex reporting, implementing advanced use cases with ML models, and creating custom audiences by joining with first-party data. You can use this framework for detailed or large-scale data analysis. We will also share some best practices to get you started.
programs.short_description: Learn how to use the BigQuery export for Google Analytics to analyze event level and user data.

programs.title: Deep dive into Flutter deep linking
programs.description: Join us to dive deep into Flutter's deep linking system. Learn about how following best practices here can improve your users' experiences and drive increased ROI.
programs.short_description: Join us to dive deep into Flutter's deep linking system.

programs.title: Optimize performance and app experiences with deep linking
programs.description:
Deep links enable you to direct users into your app, boost engagement rates, and drive business growth.

In this session, you'll learn about the benefits and implementation of deep links and the new developer tools that will help you with prioritization and validation of the misconfigured links in your app.
programs.short_description: Discover the benefits of using deep links into your app and learn about new deep links management tools for developers.

programs.title: Build smarter Android apps with on-device machine learning
programs.description: Discover the latest developer APIs for machine learning on Android and its benefits. Review the tools and solutions available to enable ML in your app. Learn about the new ML Kit API and the latest developments to run TensorFlow Lite models on Android.
programs.short_description: Learn how to build smarter Android apps with on-device machine learning, whether you have ML experience or not.

programs.title: 10 things to know about the Privacy Sandbox on Android
programs.description: User privacy is important. Get the latest information about the Privacy Sandbox on Android and see how you can start building solutions to serve mobile ads in a privacy preserving way.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest developments for the Privacy Sandbox on Android and get ready for limited production testing.

programs.title: Activity embedding: large screen layout for multi-activity apps
programs.description: Activity embedding is the fastest, easiest way to optimize multiple-activity apps for large screens. Learn how activity embedding and Jetpack WindowManager enable you to configure your app layout to make the most of large screens with no code refactoring. Learn advanced features such as how to embed another app's activity within your own app.
programs.short_description: Learn how activity embedding enables you to optimize your activity-based apps for large screens.

programs.title: Best practices for saving UI state on Android
programs.description: Saving a UI state properly is essential for providing a great UX experience. Your users might be disappointed if your screen doesn't preserve its state during a configuration change, activity recreation, or system-initiated process death. Learn best practices to save UI state properly in both the View system and Jetpack Compose by comparing APIs such as remember, rememberSaveable, onSaveInstanceState, ViewModel, and SavedStateHandle.
programs.short_description: Learn best practices to save UI state properly in both the View system and Jetpack Compose by comparing APIs.

programs.title: Build modern Android apps with Material You for Compose
programs.description: This talk will give developers and designers insight on how to use the latest from Material Design to build beautiful apps using Compose, the future of developing apps in Android.
programs.short_description: Learn the latest of Material Design 3 colors, typography, and dynamic theming for Compose to make modern Android apps.

programs.title: Building for the future of Android
programs.description: Explore a cross section of what's new and what's likely to come in Android, including topics like background work, working across devices, adapting to user preferences, and more – aimed at supporting you in future proofing app development.
programs.short_description: Learn what's new and what's likely to come to help future proof Android development.

programs.title: Building high quality Android camera experiences
programs.description: Learn what’s new in Android Camera and how to bring premium capabilities to your users, including Night & HDR capture, optimized zoom, zero shutter lag, CameraX, Extensions API updates, foldable compatibility, and more. Hear how top Android apps are implementing the best of Android Camera.
programs.short_description: Learn to introduce new camera capabilities– Night & HDR capture, optimized zoom, zero shutter lag, CameraX & more.

programs.title: Developing high quality apps for large screens and foldables
programs.description: Foldables, tablets, and other large screen devices represent a fast growing Android device segment. These devices offer differentiated capabilities to Android users, increasing their expectations of what Android can do. Learn how to improve your app experience to take full advantage of what these devices have to offer.
programs.short_description: Learn how to make your app great on large screens and foldables.

programs.title: High quality Android media experiences
programs.description: Maximize the quality of your audio and video experiences on Android. Learn about the latest developments in Android media, including spatial audio, HDR video, HDR images, and Performance Class 14. Next, explore the 1.0 release of the new Jetpack Media3 library – the new recommended solution for building media experiences. Last, get an overview of updates to existing APIs for playback and media controls as well as new and upcoming APIs for video transcoding and editing.
programs.short_description: Maximize the quality of your Android audio and video experiences by leveraging the latest APIs and capabilities.

programs.title: How to build high quality experiences on Wear OS
programs.description: From adding tiles to integrating notifications, there are plenty of opportunities for your Wear OS app to shine. Learn how to set your app apart by adding surfaces and features to drive engagement. Designers can preview new and exciting updates for building Wear OS watch faces.
programs.short_description: Learn how to drive engagement with your Wear OS app and build a high quality user experience.

programs.title: How to test across all screen sizes
programs.description: More screens shouldn’t mean more bugs! Learn what new tools are available to automate testing across phones, foldables, tablets, and ChromeOS and how to apply them to the areas most important for providing a great user experience.
programs.short_description: Learn to automate testing across phones, foldables, tablets, and ChromeOS for a great user experience.

programs.title: Jetpack Compose Debugging
programs.description: Jetpack Compose has brought a whole new approach to developing Android apps and this brings a new set of techniques for debugging. Learn how to address common challenges when developing with Compose code, like why is (or isn’t!) my composable recomposing, performance optimization, layout inspection, composition tracing and more.
programs.short_description: Learn techniques to debug common issues faced when developing with Jetpack Compose.

programs.title: Level up! Build great games for large screens
programs.description: Discover best practices to improve and expand beyond phone form factors.  After this session, you'll understand the technical considerations for good resizability, continuity, and input handling and how a little work helps create great experiences for your players across Android Large Screen tablets, foldables, Google Play Games on PC, and on ChromeOS.
programs.short_description: Discover best practices to improve and expand beyond phone form factors.

programs.title: Material You for large screens
programs.description: Learn how to use Material Design across form factors and devices like tablets, foldables, phones, and more.  Explore new large screen guidance and previews of future work that can help you adapt your app for large screens.
programs.short_description: Learn how to use Material Design across form factors and devices like tablets, foldables, phones, and more.

programs.title: Privacy Sandbox: Attribution Reporting across Chrome and Android
programs.description: Learn more about the Privacy Sandbox effort, with a deep dive into Attribution Reporting across Chrome and Android and how to get involved and start implementing solutions.
programs.short_description: Learn more about the Privacy Sandbox effort, with a deep dive into Attribution Reporting across platforms.

programs.title: Reduce reliance on passwords in Android apps with passkey support
programs.description: Learn how you can provide a more secure and seamless authentication journey in your app by using passkeys and Android's Credential Manager API. Passkeys are the new industry standard for passwordless authentication, providing a seamless and secure experience while overcoming many of the security and usability issues that legacy authentication solutions – such as passwords – have. Credential Manager supports passkeys on Android apps along with legacy authentication methods.
programs.short_description: Learn how to make authentication journeys more seamless and secure using passkeys and Android's Credential Manager API.

programs.title: Rethinking Dart interoperability with Android
programs.description: In the past, Flutter only supported integration with Android libraries through a message-based approach called platform channels. With a new command using JNI to bridge to Android system APIs, Flutter developers can easily access platform APIs without needing to use a platform channel or plugin. This session will dive deeper into how Dart automatically creates bindings for cross-language interoperation and demo how to call a Jetpack Library directly from Dart in a Flutter app.
programs.short_description: Learn how to generate Dart bindings to easily access Android platform APIs.

programs.title: Scalable UI testing solutions
programs.description: Writing great UI tests is critical to building a high quality and consistent experience for your users. But writing effective tests and scaling to all the form-factors you care about can be difficult. Learn new APIs to write tests against synchronous device configuration changes, how to execute on real devices at scale using Gradle Managed Devices and Firebase, and write efficient host-side UI regression tests for all your target device screen sizes.
programs.short_description: Learn how to write UI tests across device configuration changes using the new DeviceController API.

programs.title: What's new in Android development tools
programs.description: Get an overview of what's new in Android Studio for Android app developers, including demos and a presentation of relevant features that can accelerate your workflow on the latest Android APIs.
programs.short_description: Get an overview of relevant features in Android Studio that can accelerate your workflow on the latest Android APIs.

speakers.name: Jamal Eason
speakers.role: Director of Product Management, Android Studio

programs.title: What's new in Android privacy and security
programs.description: With Android, security and privacy are fundamental and a key focus of our product strategy. We’re continuing to invest in this across the Android platform and the Google Play ecosystem. This session will give you an overview of how we are improving security and privacy.
programs.short_description: Get the latest on Android’s newest protection features and learn how to build more secure, privacy-centric apps.

programs.title: What's new in Firebase's Android SDK
programs.description: At Firebase, we’re always looking for ways to improve the experience for developers who use our product, and that applies to our Android SDK. In this session you will learn about the recent improvements that we made over the past year and get a sneak peek of what we’re working on for the future.
programs.short_description: Learn about the past year improvements in the Firebase's Android SDK and get a sneak peek of what we’re working on.

programs.title: What's new in Health on Android
programs.description: See what we're doing to build a seamless Health platform that works across Android devices along with ecosystem support. Discover new features across Health Connect and Wear Health Services in addition to exciting use cases within the developer ecosystem.
programs.short_description: See what we're doing to build a Health platform and ecosystem support into Android.

programs.title: What's new in Kotlin for Android
programs.description: Discover exciting updates coming to Kotlin for Android developers this year, including the upcoming K2 compiler, using KTS for Gradle build scripts, improvements in Kotlin Symbol Processing, and some news about Kotlin Multiplatform.
programs.short_description: Discover the latest in the K2 compiler, KTS for Gradle build scripts, Kotlin Symbol Processing, and Kotlin Multiplatform.

programs.title: What's new in TV and intro to Compose
programs.description: If you're a designer or developer building experiences for the living room, this material is for you. Discover how both Android TV and Google TV have grown this past year. Explore TV and Compose integrations, including scrollable containers, handling focus, navigation, TV-specific components, and more.
programs.short_description: Get the latest updates about TV and learn how to use Compose as a UI tooklit for modern, performant living room apps.

speakers.name: Shobana Radhakrishnan
speakers.role: Senior Director of Engineering, Google TV

programs.title: What's new in Web on Android
programs.description: This talk deep dives into the different ways to embed web content into your Android app. Learn about the latest updates to WebView, how Custom Tabs are now much more flexible and other exciting updates to the Web on Android ecosystem.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest updates to WebView, Custom Tabs and other ways to include web content into your Android app.

speakers.name: Adriana Jara Salazar
speakers.role: Senior Developer Relations Engineer for Chrome

programs.title: What’s new with Android for cars
programs.description: This session will highlight Google's commitment to automotive, and how we’re enabling developers to bring new app experiences in the car - with minimal effort required.
programs.short_description: Discover how we’re enabling developers to bring new app experiences in the car with minimal effort required.

speakers.name: Jennifer Tsau
speakers.role: Group Product Manager, Google Automotive Services

programs.title: Introducing new ARCore geospatial features and tools
programs.description: Learn about new planned updates to ARCore Geospatial API. This session will cover new geospatial tools and services available on iOS and Android.
programs.short_description: Learn about the newly launched geospatial tools and how to build world-scale AR experiences remotely.

programs.title: Building for education, 100+ million users
programs.description: Learn about the latest trends in education and how you can get involved in the market. Education offers an exciting opportunity to inspire and reach over 100M users through integrations with Google products like Google Classroom and Chromebooks. This talk will cover how to reach the education market with tools like Classroom add-ons, easy licensing and deployment tools, Chromebook developer resources, and more.
programs.short_description: This session will cover the latest tools & trends in education to help you get integrated into the classroom.

speakers.name: James O'Reilly
speakers.role: Developer Relations Engineering Manager, Edu Ecosystem

programs.title: Build a Firebase Extension to connect millions of devs to your product
programs.description: Firebase Extensions allow developers to perform common backend tasks easier. For the past 3 years, we’ve developed dozens of extensions helping developers develop apps or use 3rd-party APIs like Algolia, Stripe, and Twilio. Starting today you can sign up, build, and publish your own extension on extensions.dev for Firebase and Google Cloud developers. This could be either a utility package, an API integration, database functionality, or something else. The possibilities are limitless.
programs.short_description: Starting today, you can build and publish your own Firebase Extension on extensions.dev.

programs.title: Build no-code, AI-powered apps for Google Workspace
programs.description: AppSheet is Google’s platform for building no-code custom apps and workflows to automate business processes. It lets app creators build and deploy end-to-end apps and automations for Google Workspace without writing code. In this session you’ll learn about the new no-code Chat app builder and how to use it to build Chat apps in 5 minutes or less.  You'll also explore the new AppSheet databases, a built-in database that enables developers to easily and securely manage app data.
programs.short_description: Learn about AppSheet’s new no-code Google Chat app builder, databases, and more.

programs.title: Extend Google Workspace using apps, APIs, and workflows
programs.description: Google Workspace reaches over 3 billion people a month and provides developers and partners with the platform and tools to build world class solutions and workflows, whether to solve a simple team problem or a scalable enterprise application. In this session, you’ll learn about our vision for AI, including how it will shape productivity and collaboration.  You'll also get the latest updates on extensibility and workflow tools the Google Workspace platform brings to your organization.
programs.short_description: Get the latest updates on extensibility and workflow tools the Google Workspace platform brings to developers.

programs.title: Web applications with Firebase and Google Cloud
programs.description: Firebase and Google Cloud are a powerful combination for building fast, scalable, and reliable web applications. Cloud Run allows you to easily serve your backend code written in any programming language. Firebase adds a custom domain, a global content delivery network, and many more useful integrations. Together, Firebase and Cloud Run make it easy to build and deploy web apps that can handle large amounts of traffic.
programs.short_description: Learn how to build fast, scalable, and reliable web apps with Firebase and Google Cloud using any programming language.

programs.title: What's new in Cloud Firestore
programs.description: Developers love Firestore because of how quickly and cost-effectively they can create an application end-to-end. Over 4 million databases have been created in Firestore, and Firestore with Firebase Authentication powers more than 1 billion monthly active users. In this session, learn what’s new from Firestore including: the latest query features, Eventarc integration that supports triggering in new compute destinations, and Terraform provisioning.
programs.short_description: Learn what’s new from Firestore including the latest query features, Eventarc triggers, and Terraform provisioning.

programs.title: Design for every device with Flutter and Material 3
programs.description: Material 3 brings new widgets to help create beautiful designs for every device that Flutter supports. Layouts can be quite different depending on the platform they are running on and what input devices are currently active. Deep dive into the various ways you can create with adaptive layouts, expressive color and typography, and theming the many widgets available for Material 3. Theming does not have to be hard when a design can be broken down into reusable widgets.
programs.short_description: Create beautiful apps on every platform using adaptive layouts, new Material 3 widgets, and platform adaptation.

programs.title: Ship faster with feature flags using Firebase Remote Config
programs.description: Feature flagging helps you increase development speed, reduce risk of production issues, and build confidence that your customers will love your new feature. Learn how Remote Config integrates with Crashlytics and Google Analytics to give you complete visibility and control over your feature launches – in real time.
programs.short_description: Learn how feature flagging in Remote Config works with Crashlytics and Google Analytics to launch features in real time.

programs.title: Supercharge Firebase with Terraform
programs.description: Have you ever wanted to automate your Firebase project setup to make it happen just so? This session will explore how Firebase users can now use Terraform to manage multiple Firebase projects for different environments. We'll cover how Terraform works and how you can get started!
programs.short_description: Explore how you can use Terraform to manage multiple Firebase projects for different environments.

programs.title: What's new in Firebase Crashlytics
programs.description: Learn how Crashlytics' crash grouping algorithm helps you identify, diagnose, and resolve issues that are most impactful to your users. We'll also demonstrate how your team can work more efficiently using Crashlytics' new integration with Android Studio's App Quality Insights windows, where you can quickly fix and debug issues right from your IDE! Plus, we will highlight improved stacktraces and GWP-ASan reporting to help debug tricky native memory errors.
programs.short_description: Get updates about Crashlytics like the grouping algorithm, Android Studio integration, GWP-ASan support, and more.

programs.title: What's new in Firebase's Flutter SDK
programs.description: Firebase provides you with APIs and tools to build, release, and operate full-stack apps for many platforms, including Flutter. In this session you will learn about the latest improvements that we made and what we’re working on for the future.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest Firebase features supported by the Flutter SDK and what's coming next.

programs.title: Building a package in Dart
programs.description: Learn best practices for building Dart and Flutter packages for distribution using Pub. See how to run tests, collect code coverage, run integration tests, handle breaking changes, and more.
programs.short_description: Learn how to build and publish a Dart and Flutter package using best practices.

programs.title: Flutter, Dart, and Raspberry Pi
programs.description: Learn how Flutter on the Raspberry Pi enables makers to build exciting new embedded user interfaces.  The Raspberry Pi was introduced as a tool to teach computer science, but since its introduction has been a staple in every maker’s toolbox. It’s been used as the basis for maker projects such as IoT devices, game emulators, and kiosks. So this is the answer to "What would a Flutter & Raspberry Pi game console look like?"
programs.short_description: Learn how Flutter paired with Raspberry Pi enables makers to build exciting new embedded user interfaces.

programs.title: Tour of Impeller - Flutter's new rendering engine
programs.description: Flutter’s new rendering engine was developed with the goal of eliminating shader compilation jank and providing predictable performance. This talk will discuss the design of Impeller and how it fits into the broader architecture for Flutter. This includes a tour of Impeller’s sub frameworks, and a demonstration of how lower level APIs are used in Flutter applications. The session will also discuss how Impeller enables new experiences, like 3D support.
programs.short_description: This talk will discuss the design of Impeller and how it enables next generation UI development.

programs.title: Boost your revenue with Play Commerce
programs.description: Learn how to optimize your app monetization with our commerce platform, including new tools for price testing, improvements to subscriptions on Google Play, and new merchandising sales channels.
programs.short_description: Learn what's new in Play Commerce and the latest monetization tools we are investing in to help grow your business.

programs.title: What great quality looks like on Google Play
programs.description: Google Play rewards high quality apps and games with better visibility and access to the most impactful treatments across the lifecycle. Learn more about what our editorial team is looking for as we showcase a number of titles that we consider high quality, and explain why we think they’re great.
programs.short_description: High quality titles are rewarded on Play. Set yourself up for success with an inside look at how we evaluate quality.

programs.title: Level up your Smart Home integration with Matter
programs.description: Learn about tools and techniques the developers can leverage to level up Smart Home integrations. As part of this talk, we will cover multi-stack integrations to bring your cloud-to-cloud and local projects to matter, discuss how Google and CSA certification programs complement each other, and go through the tools and techniques available to improve your integration quality.
programs.short_description: Learn about tools and techniques that developers can leverage to level up Smart Home integrations.

programs.title: Use data-driven, advanced styling to build immersive map experiences
programs.description: Build highly customized maps to provide a richer user experience and showcase your brand, with new Google Maps Platform capabilities. Use data-driven styling to display and style Google’s polygons for administrative boundaries with your business data, and learn about brand new styling capabilities. Utilize Advanced Markers to create customized, more performant markers to help differentiate your brand. Learn how to use these tools to easily create more engaging, custom map experiences.
programs.short_description: Build customized and engaging interactive maps with new capabilities.

speakers.name: Mira Leung
speakers.role: Staff Software Engineer, Google Maps Platform

programs.title: Building communications and contact center apps for the Web
programs.description: Learn how you can differentiate and optimize communications and contact center software on ChromeOS while learning about the latest Web and ChromeOS Connector technologies and best practices from Google engineers.
programs.short_description: Learn how to optimize communications and contact center apps using the latest Web and ChromeOS technologies.

programs.title: Developing kiosk apps for ChromeOS
programs.description: ChromeOS is a secure and reliable platform for delivering kiosk and digital signage solutions to users in educational institutions and enterprises, from testing in schools to self-service utilities in businesses. Learn how to create and deploy your kiosk app, explore example solutions, and try kiosk mode out on a range of supported devices today.
programs.short_description: Uncover how ChromeOS can be used to deliver kiosk and digital signage solutions to your users and customers.

programs.title: Evolving Flutter's support for the web
programs.description: Flutter apps on the web are loading faster and have better integration with HTML in the latest release. We will also be sharing our progress on compiling Flutter web apps to WebAssembly.
programs.short_description: Explore Flutter for web's new capabilities.

programs.title: Rethinking reactivity with Signals
programs.description: Introducing Signals, a new reactivity model in Angular. Signals equips you with more high quality tools for fine-grained reactivity, while setting you on a well lit path and providing you with guardrails to make your app performant. Learn how to start exploring the developer preview in Angular v16 today.
programs.short_description: Introducing Signals, a new reactivity model in Angular. Learn how to start exploring the developer preview today.

programs.title: What’s new in Angular
programs.description: Learn about the latest from Angular, including updates on hydration, SSR, and reactivity. Discover everything from community updates and the request for comments process to new features landing in v16 and beyond!
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest from Angular v16 and where we're headed, including updates on hydration, SSR and reactivity!

speakers.name: Minko Gechev
speakers.role: DevRel and product lead for Angular

programs.title: 9 most effective Core Web Vitals optimizations for 2023
programs.description: It seems there are about as many ways to improve web performance as there are websites themselves. Don't get overwhelmed! Learn about the 9 areas that the Chrome team has identified as the most effective opportunities to improve Core Web Vitals.
programs.short_description: Learn about the biggest performance opportunities that most developers can fix today.

programs.title: Advanced web APIs in real world apps
programs.description: Explore how a number of partners use advanced web APIs like file system access, file handling, eyedropper, local font access, and more in their real world apps. The focus is not so much on the technical implementation, but on the unlocking of use cases that these APIs enable.
programs.short_description: Explore how partners use advanced web APIs in their apps with a focus on use cases unlocked by these APIs.

programs.title: Build better forms
programs.description: Take advantage of autofill, validation and DevTools features to maximise form filling accuracy and completion rates. Make the most of new tools for form testing, and learn from our research insights.
programs.short_description: Take advantage of autofill, validation and DevTools features to maximise form filling accuracy and completion rates.

programs.title: Debugging modern web applications
programs.description: Developers use frameworks, multiple languages, and libraries to build their web applications. Browsers only see the resulting JS+HTML+CSS outputs though. Learn how Chrome DevTools is having their back and let them debug the web applications reliably, connecting both worlds, meeting developers where they are.
programs.short_description: Developers use frameworks and libraries to build their web applications. Learn how Chrome DevTools has them covered.

programs.title: How to create personalized web experiences
programs.description: Learn what's new for personalized web experiences and what's already adapting. Discover modern UI capabilities for user-centered, inclusive and joyful interfaces.
programs.short_description: Learn what's new for personalized web UX, what's already adaptive and discover capabilities for user-centered UI.

speakers.name: Adam Argyle
speakers.role: Chrome CSS and UI Developer Relations Engineer

programs.title: How to optimize web responsiveness with Interaction to Next Paint
programs.description: Dive into Interaction to Next Paint (INP), the newest performance metric in the Web Vitals program. Learn from the Chrome team how INP works and see how to use it to diagnose input responsiveness issues. One third of websites still struggle to meet the 200ms threshold for "good" INP. See what real-world sites did to improve their INP and how it affected their bottom line.
programs.short_description: Learn about measuring responsiveness with Interaction to Next Paint (INP), the newest metric in the Web Vitals program.

speakers.name: Michal Mocny
speakers.role: Software Engineer, on Chrome Speed Metrics and Core Web Vitals

programs.title: Partnering for a stable web
programs.description: After the success of previous efforts, the Chrome team is again working with Mozilla, Apple, and other partners to tackle top developer interoperability pain points as part of Interop 2023. We're hoping to improve the interoperability of the platform but also to make the status of features clearer to developers. Learn about our developer resources, our work on MDN through Open Web Docs and other contributions, and how we bring clarity of feature status to all of the content we produce.
programs.short_description: Learn how Chrome works with partners to improve interoperability and developer experience on the web platform.

speakers.name: Rachel  Andrew
speakers.role: Content Lead Chrome Web Developer Relations

programs.title: Passkeys: a simpler and safer sign-in
programs.description: After years of work, we’re finally ready to retire passwords, creating simpler, smoother, and more secure experiences for your users that seamlessly across all the major platforms. This session will detail the benefits of passkeys, how to use them to deliver streamlined authentication flows, and how to evolve your identity stack to embrace this new technology.
programs.short_description: Learn how to improve conversions and authentication UX with passkeys on your sites and apps.

programs.title: Preparing for the end of third-party cookies
programs.description: Chrome is on the path to phasing out third-party cookies and this impacts a wide range of use cases from embedded content, APIs, widgets, single sign-on, analytics, and advertising. Updates to cookie functionality like CHIPS and First-Party Sets enable you to restrict cross-site cookies on your site in a more secure and private manner. Learn how to audit your code to look for third-party cookies and what action you can take to ensure you're all set for the end of third-party cookies.
programs.short_description: Learn about updates to cookie functionality and what you can do to ensure you're set for the end of third-party cookies.

programs.title: The web: your platform for growth
programs.description: Innovative and engaging web experiences enable companies to deliver business outcomes such as increased revenue and reduced costs. Watch this session to learn more about how websites have been able to create best-in-class web experiences to drive user growth and engagement.
programs.short_description: Learn how innovative and engaging web experiences deliver business outcomes such as increased revenue and reduced costs.

programs.title: WebAssembly: a new development paradigm for the web
programs.description: WebAssembly (Wasm) is a low level, high-performance binary format for the web, which can be compiled from languages such as C++, Swift, Dart, & Kotlin. In this talk we’ll showcase new developments in language support, usability, and increased performance. We’ll also show you how to get started quickly yourself!
programs.short_description: Learn about using C++, Swift, Kotlin, and Dart on the web with WebAssembly, showcased through real world examples.

programs.title: WebDriver BiDi: The future of cross-browser automation
programs.description: If you've ever dabbled in browser automation, you know just how daunting it can be. But what exactly makes this task so challenging? And what can browser vendors do to streamline the process? Get an overview of the current state of cross-browser automation, along with insights into the inner workings of browser automation and how test frameworks utilize it. Last, delve into the driving force behind WebDriver BiDi – the forthcoming browser automation protocol.
programs.short_description: Learn how WebDriver BiDi enhances browser automation beyond "await page.click('.button');"

programs.title: WebGPU unlocks modern GPU access for Javascript
programs.description: WebGPU is a new Javascript API bringing more featureful access to the GPU while being more idiomatic to JavaScript. WebGPU is now being released in Chrome so websites can start relying on it. This session will describe WebGPU's history, show demos covering various aspects of how WebGPU improves compared to WebGL, the current alternative, and give a sneak peek at what's next in the future for WebGPU.
programs.short_description: Learn how WebGPU unlocks the power of the GPU for faster machine learning performance and better graphics rendering.

programs.title: What's new in Chrome Extensions
programs.description: Learn from the Chrome Extensions team as they share some recent changes made to the extensions platform to improve security and privacy. Get the latest updates on Manifest V3 and the commitments Google is making to extension developers. Get a sneak peek at some exciting new features, including a new extension menu, a redesigned Chrome Web Store, and the upcoming Side Panel API.
programs.short_description: Learn about new Chrome Extension API's and get an update on the status and timeline for Manifest V3.

programs.title: What's new in web UI
programs.description: The web platform is evolving quickly, with UI features to improve developer experiences, create new responsive capabilities, and enable more accessible interface defaults. Get a high level overview of what you can get excited about in the UI space and look out for on the web platform for CSS and HTML.
programs.short_description: Learn about the latest web platform updates in the CSS and HTML space.

programs.title: What's new in web animations
programs.description: Appropriate animations are a great way to help users build an accurate mental model of how a web page UI works and therefore increase usability of a web site. But it's important for a UI to feel polished and fluid to users. Shipping in Chrome is a collection of new APIs that help you build these frictionless and engaging experiences. Get a highlight of some of these new APIs: view transitions, scroll-driven animations, the linear easing function, and individual transform properties.
programs.short_description: Learn all about the newest capabilities in web animations, including view transitions and scroll-driven animations.

programs.title: How to build more inclusive models using the Monk Skin Tone Scale
programs.description: In May 2022, we open sourced the MST Scale. In this session, we continue teaching the fundamentals of ML fairness with skin tone by providing examples, golden datasets, and references for computer vision researchers to label their own data sets. This is a session created out of popular demand from developers who want more detailed directions on how to use the Monk Skin Tone Scale.
programs.short_description: Learn strategies using MST to build more inclusive models for skin tone.

programs.title: 10 ways of using machine learning with Google Cloud
programs.description: Explore the state of the art advancements in the Cloud AI API portfolio across a variety of data types, including cutting edge Speech transcription, boosting your data with knowledge graphs, and advancements with Large Language Models in the Natural Language world.
programs.short_description: Get a fast break down of 10 different and practical ways you can build machine learning applications using Google Cloud.

programs.title: Applied ML with KerasCV and KerasNLP
programs.description: KerasCV and KerasNLP are easy-to-use libraries for state-of-the-art computer vision and natural language processing. With just a few lines of code you’ll employ the latest techniques and models for data augmentation, object detection, image and text generation, and text classification. We also demonstrate integration with the broader TensorFlow ecosystem including TFLite, TPUs, and DTensor.
programs.short_description: KerasCV and KerasNLP are easy to use libraries for state-of-the-art computer vision and natural language processing.

programs.title: Boost your conversational experiences with Generative AI
programs.description: Looking to build an interactive, AI-driven customer experience? In this session you'll learn about Google Cloud's next generation of conversational experiences that use generative AI in Gen App Builder to help you turn large volumes of data into easy-to-access human-like answers. Deliver more natural omnichannel customer experiences with virtual agents that are built with the same deep learning technologies that power Google Assistant.
programs.short_description: Learn how new generative AI and conversational capabilities in Gen App Builder can create amazing customer experiences.

programs.title: Discover pre-trained models with Kaggle Models
programs.description: Pre-trained models are an important part of modern ML workflows, but it’s not always easy to find the best one for your needs. With the launch of Kaggle Models, we’re making thousands of models from Google Research, Deepmind, and other sources more accessible to the ML developer community alongside our ML resource hub of 200k+ public datasets. To showcase how to use Kaggle Models to improve ML projects, we’ll demo how to use an open source model from Kaggle and use it to submit to a competition.
programs.short_description: Introducing Kaggle Models, a community hub for leading open source pre-trained models.

programs.title: Easy on-device Machine Learning with MediaPipe
programs.description: Learn about the next generation of MediaPipe Solutions, a product suite that enables developers to easily integrate on-device machine learning solutions into applications across platforms: Android, web, desktop, and many more. You can also customize some of these solutions easily using your own training dataset in just a few lines of code. Join us to know more about the new solutions and features that were just launched!
programs.short_description: MediaPipe Solutions provide easy-to-use and customizable On-device ML solutions on Android, web and other platforms.

programs.title: Safe and responsible development with Generative Language Models
programs.description: Generative language models are an incredible new technology that enable computers to converse about almost any topic. Unfortunately, we don't always know what those models are going to say. How do we ensure that our applications don't produce inappropriate content? In this talk, we'll explore guidance for curbing those risks and developing safe and responsible LLM-backed applications.
programs.short_description: Guidance for responsible development of applications with large language models (LLMs), from planning to testing.

programs.title: Scaling large language models in the cloud
programs.description: So you’ve learned how to prototype with Large Language Models (LLMs), but what’s next? Supercharge your generative AI dev skills in this session where you’ll learn common use cases for LLMs and how to integrate them into your apps using Google Cloud Vertex AI.
programs.short_description: Learn use cases for LLMs and how to integrate them into your apps with generative AI in Google Cloud's Vertex AI.

speakers.name: Nikita Namjoshi
speakers.role: ML Engineer & Developer Advocate, Google Cloud

programs.title: Simple ML for Sheets
programs.description: Simple ML for Sheets is a Google Sheets addon that helps you use machine learning (ML). Designed for beginners, it enables you to work without coding or ML expertise. Learn how you can use Simple ML for Sheets on your own data and bring the power of ML to your business.
programs.short_description: Simple ML lets you use machine learning on your own data in Google Sheets and without coding or ML expertise.

programs.title: The AI/ML developer journey - how to get started
programs.description: So you've seen an impressive array of tools for ML, but have no idea where to start? Data? Models? Transfer Learning? Ops? It can be bewildering! In this session, Laurence Moroney, AI Lead at Google will take you from soup to nuts in understanding how it all hangs together, and give valuable advice and tips in what you need to get into the wonderful world of AI and ML.
programs.short_description: Learn the developer journey, from data to models to deployment to ops. Get started with FOSS technology from Google.

programs.title: What's new in TensorFlow and Keras
programs.description: Learn how features in the TensorFlow API and ecosystem will help you build and deploy advanced new models. Explore the next generation of modeling, with improved efficiency, performance, and flexibility.
programs.short_description: The TensorFlow ecosystem is better than ever, giving developers new tools to access the next generation of ML.

speakers.name: Mani Varadarajan
speakers.role: Director of Engineering, Machine Learning Framework APIs

programs.title: What's new with Web ML in 2023?
programs.description: Join the TensorFlow.js and MediaPipe teams at Google to learn about the latest updates around Web ML in 2023 to be productive and bring your next business idea to life. Build the next generation of web apps powered by AI and machine learning. Learn about new models, performance improvements, and improved tooling, all accessible from within the browser and beyond.
programs.short_description: Join TensorFlow.js and MediaPipe to learn about Web ML in 2023 - build next gen web apps powered by AI

programs.title: Faster, cheaper serverless APIs for your Firebase app
programs.description: Build APIs with less cold starts while saving cost with the second generation of Cloud Functions for Firebase. Does that seem too good to be true? Find out how, as we share how to use Cloud Functions for Firebase's new concurrency option to make it easy to run fast, efficient, and scalable server code.
programs.short_description: Reduce cold starts and cost using the new concurrency option available in Cloud Functions for Firebase (2nd gen).

programs.title: Create immersive map experiences with new capabilities
programs.description: Create immersive map visualization experiences directly in your web app with new capabilities in Google Maps Platform. Learn more about how to create customized map visualization experiences using these new capabilities in this session.
programs.short_description: Create immersive map experiences with new capabilities

programs.title: Add ML to your applications via simple database queries
programs.description: Looking for an easy way to add ML to your applications or make predictions about your data? Google Cloud doesn't require any prior ML experience or special tools. Learn how database and analytics products including AlloyDB, Spanner, and BigQuery enable any developer or data analyst to make ML-based predictions using familiar SQL queries, without building any integrations or moving data around.
programs.short_description: With AlloyDB, Spanner, and BigQuery, it doesn't require any prior ML experience or special tools.

programs.title: Build more secure apps with Go and Google
programs.description: Go's Vulnerability Management System enables Go developers to detect and remediate known vulnerabilities in their dependencies at every stage of the software development lifecycle — from the IDE to production. Combined with Google's other software security supply chain initiatives like OSV-Scanner, OpenSSF Scorecard, and deps.dev, Google and Go provide developers the tools they need to write more secure software.
programs.short_description: Go and Google enable developers to detect vulnerabilities at every stage of the software development lifecycle.

speakers.name: Nicky Ringland
speakers.role: Product Manager, Google Open Source Security Team

programs.title: Enterprise Search: an LLM-enabled out-of-the-box search engine
programs.description: With the rise of Large Language Models, search engines are rapidly evolving with the "semantic search" capability. Not only do they find information with keyword matching, they deeply understand the meaning and intent of user queries from searching across texts and images to realize the AI-driven user experience (AI-UX) that is becoming the new standard. Tune into this session to explore the out-of-the-box dev tools from Enterprise Search that answers user questions like never before.
programs.short_description: Enterprise Search provides next-gen "semantic search" powered by LLMs that deeply understands user queries and intents.

programs.title: Secure your development environments and software supply chain
programs.description: Software supply chain security starts where code is created, in the development environments/IDEs. Learn how to adopt a Zero Trust security posture for your development teams without sacrificing developer productivity, using Cloud Workstations for pre-configured and secure development environments, BeyondCorp Enterprise for context-aware access and data loss prevention, and Virtual Artifact repositories and Assured Open Source Software packages to increase the security of your dependencies.
programs.short_description: Learn how to secure your development environments with Cloud Workstations, BeyondCorp Enterprise, and Assured OSS.

programs.title: Using Google Cloud's latest services to build data-driven apps
programs.description: In this era of Internet-scale, data-intensive applications, your success is determined by your ability to put data to work. Google Cloud gives you an open, standard-based platform to build your apps and ensure portability and easy integration. Learn about new services that give you more flexibility in the way you deploy your databases, an easier way to build secure, reliable, high performance applications, and new capabilities for building apps, analyzing data, and making decisions.
programs.short_description: Learn about AlloyDB Omni, a high-performance, downloadable PostgreSQL-compatible database with integrated analytics.

programs.title: Enhance your app security with new features in Firebase App Check
programs.description: Learn how to safeguard logins, discover insights on ML endpoints, explore AI features, and defend against cheating with the new replay protection in Firebase App Check. Learn how to improve your security for games, IoT devices, and more with the new Unity and C++ SDKs.
programs.short_description: Learn how to improve your security for games and IoT devices and use new replay protections in Firebase App Check.

programs.title: Secure your app against DDOS, API Abuse, Hijacking, and Fraud
programs.description: All web and mobile applications are constantly under attack. Join this session to learn how you can leverage WAF (Cloud Armor), API (APIgee), and Fraud (reCAPTCHA) defenses to protect your applications, websites, and APIs. Learn how to tackle DDoS attacks, API abuse, bot fraud and more, all while maintaining your pace of innovation. Discover new launches, including ML protections in Apigee and mobile SDK and fraud prevention in reCAPTCHA Enterprise.
programs.short_description: Leverage WAF (CloudArmor), API (APIgee), and Fraud (reCAPTCHA) defenses to protect your apps, websites and APIs.

speakers.name: Cy Khormaee
speakers.role: Director, Product Management User Protection Services

programs.title: Run your website with the latest Node＆Python frameworks on Firebase
programs.description: Deploying dynamic web apps with Firebase has never been easier! Come learn how to combine the power of Firebase Hosting and Cloud Functions to run Angular Universal, Astro, Django, Flask, Next.js, Nuxt, and SvelteKit web apps with ‘firebase deploy.’ We’ll show you how easy it is to get started, and dive into a bunch of exciting new enhancements along the way.
programs.short_description: Firebase can now run Angular Universal, Astro, Django, Flask, Next.js, Nuxt, and SvelteKit apps with Firebase deploy.

programs.title: Advanced state and side effects in Jetpack Compose
programs.description: In this workshop you will learn advanced concepts related to State and Side Effects APIs in Jetpack Compose. We'll see how to create a state holder for stateful composables whose logic isn't trivial and how to create coroutines and call suspend functions from Compose code. We'll learn what are side effects, and different APIs, like LaunchedEffect and rememberUpdatedState, to trigger them and accomplish different use cases.
programs.short_description: In this workshop, you will learn advanced concepts related to State and Side Effects APIs in Jetpack Compose.

programs.title: Build a complete app with Relay and Compose
programs.description: Relay helps app development teams using Figma and Compose build great UI fast. In this workshop, you'll learn multiple integration strategies for producing complete Compose apps with Relay.
programs.short_description: Learn how to integrate Relay into Compose apps and speed up your design to code workflow.

programs.title: Building a data layer
programs.description: In this workshop, you'll learn about the data layer and how it fits into your overall app architecture. Build the data layer for a TODO app which creates, stores, and updates tasks. Explore repositories, data sources, and data models. Last, discover how to expose data using streams, and how to test that your data layer is behaving as it should.
programs.short_description: Learn how to build a scalable data layer for your app.

programs.title: Get started with new geospatial tools on a creator platform
programs.description: Learn about the new geospatial tools and services available on a creator platform. This workshop will cover how to build and preview geospatially anchored 3D content.
programs.short_description: Learn about the new geospatial tools available on ARCore. This workshop is recommended for new developers and creators.

programs.title: Get started with new geospatial tools on a developer platform
programs.description: Learn about the new geospatial tools and services available on a developer platform. This workshop will cover how to build and preview geospatially anchored 3D content.
programs.short_description: Learn about the new geospatial tools available on ARCore. This workshop is recommended for developers.

programs.title: Building next-gen UIs in Flutter
programs.description: Learn how to use custom shaders and a new animation package to add mesmerizing effects to your UIs.
programs.short_description: Explore next generation user interfaces in Flutter using the power of shaders and animation.

programs.title: Getting started with Angular Signals
programs.description:
Introducing Signals, a new reactivity model in Angular. Signals equips you with high quality tools for fine-grained reactivity,
while setting you on a well lit path and providing you with guardrails to make your app performant. Learn how to start exploring the developer preview in Angular v16 today.
programs.short_description: Introducing Signals, a new reactivity model in Angular. Join our engineers as you develop your first app with Signals!

programs.title: Learn how to implement passkeys with form autofill in a web app
programs.description: A passkey is a new way for users to sign in simply and securely, using just a fingerprint, face, or device PIN. Today, developers can implement passkeys on web or mobile, helping drive more traffic to their site with reduced login friction and password breaches. In this workshop, we'll start with a basic website with username and password sign-in form and extend it to support passkeys. By the end, you'll learn how to create passkeys, enabling a simple and secure way for your users to sign in.
programs.short_description: Learn how to create passkeys, enabling a simple and secure way for your web users to sign in.

programs.title: Hands-on Responsible AI with the People and AI guidebook
programs.description: Get an overview of Google's latest tools and resources for Responsible AI. Learn to use the People and AI Research (PAIR) guidebook on how to build generative AI products efficiently and responsibly.
programs.short_description: In this workshop, instructors will walk through using Google's tools for Responsible AI.

programs.title: Image data classification with BigQuery ML
programs.description: In this workshop, we will discuss the use case of storing and analyzing example images of Yoga Poses in BigQuery. You'll learn how to implement a classification model with BigQuery ML to label the poses using only SQL constructs and no other form of code.
programs.short_description: Store and analyze images in BigQuery. Implement a classification model with BigQuery ML.

programs.title: On-device Large Language Models with Keras and Android
programs.description: Learn how to load a large language model built with Keras, optimize it, and deploy on your Android device!
programs.short_description: Learn how to load a large language model built with Keras, quantize it and deploy on your Android device!

programs.title: Supercharge your web app with machine learning and MediaPipe
programs.description: As a web developer, you already know that machine learning can greatly enhance your web applications. But maybe you haven't added those amazing features you've been wanting as you don't have time to learn the deep learning concepts required to make a good ML solution. Fortunately, you now have MediaPipe which can create custom cross-platform ML solutions for common tasks without ML expertise. Learn how to create custom solutions and leave with exciting ideas to supercharge your web app.
programs.short_description: Learn the steps to create custom solutions, and leave with exciting ideas to supercharge your web app with ML.

programs.title: Building with Firebase webframeworks
programs.description:
Explore the newest features offered by Firebase Auth, Hosting, Firestore, Functions by building a web app from scratch!
Learn how to build and enhance your web app using assets from Firebase, using the latest integrations from Angular X Firebase.
programs.short_description: Explore the newest features offered by Firebase Auth, Hosting, Firestore, Functions by building a web app from scratch!

speakers.role: Director of Product Management, Android Studio

speakers.name: Jennifer Tsau
speakers.role: Group Product Manager, Google Automotive Services
